Computational Geosciences Minor.Description: Focuses on computational methods in geosciences using high-level programming tools.

Core.Title: Introduction to Geology or Physical Geology

Notes: Registration for any of these courses requires that existing prerequisite course requirements are adequately met.
Petitions to substitute another course to use toward any requirement must be submitted to the JSG Advising Office prior to the start of the semester in question.

Geosciences Minor.Description: Provides an understanding of the Earth’s history, evolution, and properties.

Core.Title: Introduction to Geology or Physical Geology

Notes: Registration for any of these courses requires that existing prerequisite course requirements are adequately met.
Petitions to substitute another course to use toward any requirement must be submitted to the JSG Advising Office prior to the start of the semester in question.

Hydrology Minor.Description: Focuses on the water cycle and associated hydrological processes.

Introduction to Physical and Chemical Hydrogeology

Petitions to substitute another course to use toward any requirement must be submitted to the JSG Advising Office prior to the start of the semester in question.

Sedimentology and Earth Surface Processe.Description: Focuses on processes shaping the Earth’s surface and the rock record.

Computational Science and Engineering Ce.Description: Sponsored by multiple schools including the Jackson School of Geosciences, it focuses on advanced computational methods in science and engineering.
Computational Science and Engineering Ce.Notes: Details about the requirements for this certificate can be found in the Cockrell School of Engineering's Minor and Certificates section of the Undergraduate Catalog.
